programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A rescue mission in Syria reveals evidence that indicates an American was involved in a social worker's capture; DiNozzo's strange behavior is questioned.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When dozens of children from military families come down with a mysterious illness, the team tries to deliver a cure before the holidays.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When the city's internet is shut down three weeks before Christmas, the team consults with three imprisoned cyberterrorists.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is attacked by a man who claims to have information about his half-brother, who died decades earlier; Jake and Bishop talk about their future.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Evidence from the murder of a Navy captain leads the NCIS team to Ducky's deceased mother; the team exchanges holiday gifts; Gibbs has Christmas dinner with Fornell.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate the altercation that caused injuries to Sen. John Phillips' son; Torres and Sloane must protect the senator as they travel from Afghanistan back to the States.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's holiday plans are put on hold when a murder investigation leads to the discovery of a newborn baby who has no identification and no apparent ties to a family.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team assist Ziva with "the one thing" she said she would need to take care of before returning to see her family.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue's next assignment hits closer to home - when she is called in to investigate a kidnapping of a deaf student.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and Lucy take in Lucy's grandmother after con men swindle the elderly woman out of her house - and set up a sting to bring the "contractors" to justice.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the FBI team capture an Al Qaeda leader planning an attack in D.C.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and Jack investigate the claim of a Deaf holocaust survivor (guest star Tony Award winner Phyllis Frelich) who insists she's recently seen a wanted Nazi war criminal.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull and Chunk's friendship is tested when Bull helps the man suspected of murdering Nella Wester, Chunk's fashion mentor.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: When Bull assists Jules Caffrey, a high-powered attorney on trial for his fianc√©e's murder, he takes advantage of his client's penchant for courtroom theatrics.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull tries to prove temporary insanity for a client who was brainwashed by a cult-like spiritual learning center to kill his father; Danny and Chunk look for the perpetrator responsible for their client's reprogramming.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull agrees to consult on three cases for criminal attorney J.P. Nunnelly in exchange for her help defending Benny, who is on trial for misconduct related to his former career with the District Attorney's office.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull and J.P. Nunnelly clash over their client, a computer cloud company that is battling the FBI to retain privacy over its client files, on the first of three cases to repay her for defending his brother, Benny at trial.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU tracks a serial killer in Wisconsin; Kate is faced with trouble when her niece, Meg, starts acting out.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When an up-and-coming congressman's wife disappears, the team investigates his political enemies as potential suspects.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: International Unit Chief Jack Garrett (Gary Sinise) and his team requires assistance from the BAU when a family of four is abducted during their Barbados vacation.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the members of a family are found murdered at their dining room table, the team looks for secrets in their past; Hotch tries to make peace with his father-in-law (Ed Asner).

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When three alleged murderers claim that they were attacked by a monster at the moment of the crimes, the BAU searches for a suspect who controls minds; the hunt puts one team member in danger.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU tracks a vigilante in Los Angeles who is shooting people with possible ties to criminal activity.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team suspects Kate's niece and her friend were kidnapped by an online predator involved in sex trafficking and race to find them before they are hurt.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU interviews candidates to take the opening left by Kate's departure; the team tracks a serial killer who leaves behind evidence that indicates a person intent on revenge.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: Detectives hope neighbors can provide information on the slaying of a Dallas father; suspects in the killing of a deaf man may be linked to an earlier unsolved murder.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A 19-year-old man is gunned down in the middle of the street; a hiker discovers the remains of a decomposed body during a walk in the woods.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A Tulsa, Okla., police detective cuts through conflicting stories in the case of a man who was shot and run over by a car; a gunman opens fire outside an Atlanta nightclub, killing one man and leaving another clinging to life.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A Tulsa, Okla., woman goes on the run after the murder of her boyfriend; an Army veteran gunned down after helping a homeless man in Atlanta.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: When a hardworking construction worker is brutally murdered on payday, Tulsa detectives discover he's fallen prey to a seemingly unlikely attacker.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Tulsa, two families devastated by domestic violence look to detectives to find justice for their loved ones.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A young Tulsa father is shot several times in his driveway after putting his 1-year-old daughter to bed; Detective Jason White hopes a pill bottle found on the scene will help lead to the killer.

programme.title: Behind the Headlines
programme.desc: Interviews with people who knew Markoff and his victims, as well as investigators and prosecutors who speak on camera about the case for the very first time.

programme.title: Beyond the Headlines: The Watts Family Tragedy
programme.desc: A deeper look into the circumstances surrounding the Chris Watts murder case includes never-before-seen footage and new interviews with Tammy Lee, the agent with the Colorado Bureau of Investigation who elicited Watt's confession.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: When two teenage classmates in Northern California go missing within weeks of each other, their mothers struggle to get police to take the situation seriously; but then, unusual cell phone activity by a group of potential suspects gets scrutinized.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: Investigators trying to determine who shot and killed a young mother in Ohio are tipped off by a surprising piece of digital evidence; from there, they unravel a twisted story of stalking and social media catfishing.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: Detectives in Aurora, Colo., gather crucial information about a double homicide from neighborhood surveillance footage, but they're not able to identify and track the killer until some key digital data is uncovered.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: When a 17-year-old transgender social media influencer in Vancouver, Wash., goes silent, her family and fans fear foul play; digital data allows detectives working on the case to track the movements of their suspect on the morning of the crime.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: Police in Mobile, Ala., quickly identify a suspect in the murder of a local college professor, but a bombshell piece of technology stolen from the crime scene then points them in a completely different direction.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: A look at the visions of mystics, prophets and clairvoyants throughout history, what their prophecies reveal and predictions for the future.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From ancient civilizations to 20th century empires, mankind has had an inexplicable fascination with preserving the dead. But why?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The animal kingdom is full of deadly predators, and some of them attack in extraordinary and inexplicable ways; some animals strike back at humans for reasons beyond normal defense and hunger.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Since the dawn of civilization, humanity has been fixated on predicting our own demise.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout human history, many cultures have used sacred rituals to express their spiritual beliefs; there are many rituals that are thought to unlock supernatural powers.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Modern prophets. Catastrophic premonitions. Dreams of future crimes. Can people really predict the future?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Our five senses construct the reality of the world around us. But what about when one or more of your senses is heightened, changed, or even taken away all together?

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: At the height of World War II, the Nazis engaged their top scientists to develop "wonder weapons"--weapons that were so scientifically advanced they could have turned the tide.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: In 1958, a bulldozer operator in Northern California discovered 16-inch human-like footprints, and the legend of Bigfoot was born.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: The ancient ruins of Puma Punku have mystified archaeologists ever since their discovery hundreds of years ago. The massive stones are precisely carved into blocks.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Ever since Plato first wrote about the mysterious island of Atlantis, it has captured the imagination of adventurers and academics alike.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: The Loch Ness Monster is one of the world's most enduring mysteries. But there have also been accounts of similar cryptids all over the planet.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: The mysterious Mediterranean island of Malta lies south of Sicily and is home to megalithic structures built by a mysterious prehistoric society.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: The imposing city of Washington D.C. was inspired by the ancient world, as seen in the Greek pillars, Roman domes and even an Egyptian-style obelisk that mark the landscape.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic
programme.desc: A look at the work of college students who take on the cases of jailed murderers who claim they're innocent. With exclusive, behind-the-scenes access to Innocence Projects

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: Law enforcers stick with cases for many years.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic
programme.desc: The conviction of a man found guilty is overturned.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: A mysterious woman calls police to say that her boyfriend is a killer; DNA tests identify a murder victim in Canada.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: When 36-year-old computer programmer Lisa Valdez fails to show up for work, her apartment manager finds her brutally murdered in her tiny studio.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: The loving aunt of a close-knit family is stabbed to death in her home. It takes two decades for detectives to discover that a key witness was an imposter--and caused the case to go cold. When they turn back to the crime scene, they discover a clue that lay hidden in plain sight for 24 years.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: The longest running cold case of a law enforcement officer in the United States was the murder of Sheriff's Lt. Joe Clark.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Model and mother Samira Frasch loves the spotlight, but when her glamorous life ends unexpectedly in her pool, investigators turn their eyes toward the web of heated relationships surrounding her family.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When a hostile online feud turns deadly, detectives hunt for a mysterious CIA operative leading to the discovery of a jaw-dropping and vengeful catfishing scheme.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: A string of murders targeting prominent law officials leaves a small Texas town gripped in fear and investigators in a race against time to stop the killer before he strikes again.

programme.title: American Justice

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve is in northeastern Pennsylvania, tripping through a dormant boneyard.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve is in the Mile High City searching for vintage metal.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve travels to Sandy, Oregon, to pay homage to the Chrysler Corporation.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve searches at All American Classics, a popular salvage yard in WA.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve Magnate finds an AMC Marlin and a Plymouth sedan in Denton, Texas.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve travels to Arizona to uncover a '60 Lincoln Continental Mark V.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve Magnante discovers a '61 Chevy Impala bubble top in Georgia.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: In the snowy landscape of Michigan's Northern Peninsula, Derek finds a 1964 Ford Galaxie that's sat abandoned for 32 years; he plans to not only get this Ford running, but also to turn it into a rally-tribute car.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with Dave Chappelle to revitalize a 1972 Jeep J2000 that's sat among a field of neglected Jeeps; together, they cobble together parts from various Jeeps to get theirs running and attempt to make the 100-mile journey to Derek's shop.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek teams up with his brother Sean to convert a 1966 Oldsmobile F-85 from a wannabe drag racer into a timeless cruiser; it'll take more than a paint job to make this car street-able, as the guys discover the engine is keeping a horrible secret.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek Bieri and Dave Chappelle find an old dually among a flock of chickens; with the goal of building this rig into a car-hauling shop truck, Derek sets his sights on major performance upgrades, while Dave gets to work on a custom suspension setup.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek enlists Steve Dulcich to help put the muscle back into a derelict Dodge Coronet. But with a completely seized drivetrain, the guys will have to replace everything on this car if they hope to make the 500-mile road trip back to Nashville.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Two brothers set out to build matching Track Rat Porsches; one lost interest due to lack of funds and time; with a Porsche racing pedigree and a not-so-stock surprise under the hood, Shea thinks this 944 is the perfect project to rescue.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Dan and Shea drive out to Clovis, New Mexico, to buy the holy grail of JDM imports, a Toyota AE86; nostalgia aside, Aaron is skeptical whether it was a good buy, or even roadworthy.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: What was supposed to be an unfinished project feels more like a mechanic special; with problem after problem, it looks like this car was closer to ending up in a landfill than laying down 11s leaving the car meet.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: A shop owner's crew builds a SR20-powered Ford Ranger Urban Assault Vehicle, but when the turbo gives out, he knows it needed to go before it become more of a distraction; Aaron fixes the reliability issues; Dan and Shea go in on suspension.

programme.title: Runs Good

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth ll's Great Britons. programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain‚Äôs seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation‚Äôs gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew FINALLY make it to the Bahamas and the incredible Green Turtle Club for a week of fishing, diving, and exploring the Abaco Island chain. With two incredible boats at our disposal, we make the 200 mile crossings from Miami and Cape Canaveral to rendezvous at Green Turtle Cay. Stay tuned for Part one of our Bahamas adventure!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Green Turtle Cay adventure continues as the LK crew uncovers more of what the incredible out islands of the Bahamas have to offer. Shifting gears to bottom fishing, Ali catches a fish of a lifetime while Rush gets to dive and spearfish with the locals.

programme.title: Chucktown
programme.desc: It's early May in Charleston, and Redfin Charters is prepping for another epic season where its team of captains will run more than 3,000 fishing charters in search of redfish and trout.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don‚Äôt recognize that they‚Äôre less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that‚Äôs caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they‚Äôll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. programme.title: Local Knowledge

With two incredible boats at our disposal, we make the 200 mile crossings from Miami and Cape Canaveral to rendezvous at Green Turtle Cay. Stay tuned for Part one of our Bahamas adventure!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Green Turtle Cay adventure continues as the LK crew uncovers more of what the incredible out islands of the Bahamas have to offer. Shifting gears to bottom fishing, Ali catches a fish of a lifetime while Rush gets to dive and spearfish with the locals.

programme.title: Chucktown

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don‚Äôt recognize that they‚Äôre less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that‚Äôs caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they‚Äôll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. Through a nostalgic lens, Captain C.A. and Captain Nick vividly depict the marina's origins, capturing the essence of its enduring significance in maritime culture.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe brings in someone very unexpected to fill out his shorthanded crew; S&S' bad luck streak continues when they wreck their boat and get into a fight with the Dreadknots; Joe and Coatsy come up with a new plan to start their own company.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes on a treasure-hunting mission and ends up in a race against Belinda; Jesse's lesson on the whistles almost takes Luke out; S&S continues to struggle; the Dreadknots' lucky charm gets destroyed.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds a legendary old grave site and the crew has an accident; Levi decides to make some major crew changes; Brad and Swilley are the victims of a prank and they lose yet another assistant; Joe and Coatsy have a tough time keeping steady work.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries out a new assistant and meets his match; Brad has an MMA title fight; the entire Big Gun crew heads out to cut the next road in high winds; Craig drops a bomb.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby and DaVi are reunited for a mission to help the people of New Orleans; the Big Gun crew scrambles to finish up the Grindstone site; Gord gets greedy and loses a load of logs; Craig loses his cool.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby gives DaVi a very unusual gift; Gabe Rygaard rushes his crew to finish a site; Joe and Coatsy get a job in Alaska; Brad decides to take a risk and dives into a river cave.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Brad and Swilley lose a fight with massive log; while gar fishing with his cousin the Swamp Man finds what could be the log raft.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby hits the lake with a squad of assistants to have one last confrontation with Richard; the Dreadknots and S&S struggle to pull enough logs to help out their ailing leader; Gord's final site offers lethal challenges.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, Rygaard goes deep into their roughest terrain yet in an attempt to recapture the title; in Alaska, Papac's dreams of a repeat are shattered when Coatsy's badly injured; in Canada, a new candidate steps into the ring.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, the Papac team struggles to find someone to fill the shoes of injured Coatsy; Gabe Rygaard and his crew scramble to make up for their slow start; In Wyoming, David Zitterkopf and Sons keep their chainsaws humming.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, Papac initiates an extremely dangerous process called Shotgun Logging; in Wyoming, the Zitterkopf men take the Bear Ranch site by storm; at Rygaard, the team doubles the yarders to increase production.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby uses an airboat to search for century-old logs; Rygaard attempts to move a six-ton cypress; David's sons hold down the fort while he delivers a load of logs to the mill; the Dreadknots suffer a late-day accident.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries to repair his custom-made buggy; David Zitterkopf makes a dangerous swing between trees; the Dreadknots go logging in the night; Triack is at a disadvantage when a crew member is injured.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Three Japanese Samurai swords; a Steiff donkey pull toy; a British WWI propaganda poster; thank-you letters sent to an infamous doctor.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War-era carbine with a coffee grinder in the shoulder stock; a vintage skateboard deck.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A warm-up jersey signed by pro basketball player Kobe Bryant; an antique weapon; the book, "Leaving Las Vegas;" an early toaster.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Gold and silver coins; tax stamps; an album signed by late singer Bob Marley; a vintage Win-a-Card game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A very valuable Pok√©mon collection; a 1926 Dunhill Watch Lighter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick stumbles upon an early Barbie doll while visiting his friend, Marie Osmond, backstage at her Vegas show; a tiny amusement park ride; a still from the movie, "Citizen Kane," signed by Orson Welles; a $10,000 certificate from 1900.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick visits his friend's brewery in San Diego; antique beer items; antique an original McCormick Farmall tractor; a signed movie slate from the movie, "Django Unchained;" a "Dogs Playing Poker" print.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare movie poster for actor John Wayne's first film; a vintage RC helicopter; nickel-plated pistols supposedly made by the most famous gun maker of the Victorian era.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick calls in a surprise expert to appraise a Ronald McDonald balloon inflator; an antique RCA inkwell; a vintage spear; Edward Curtis prints.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 18th-century "Tryal of Witches" book; a 20th-century airplane control yoke; a gold-plated banjo; the restored car from the movie, "Wayne's World."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A hat worn by musician Prince; an Egyptian scarab ring; a WWII-era head-shaped grass planter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Gibson lap steel guitar; a letter from pioneer Ezra Meeker; a set of commemorative Oregon Trail coins; a Victorian snuff box; colonial bone dice from the Stamp Act of 1765.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars take aim at an incredibly rare 18th century half-size musket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars take a mission briefing when presented with a fully functional 1941 M3 Armored Scout Truck from World War II.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy a saddle that may have been used by Kevin Costner in Dances with Wolves. Will the gang pony-up and make the deal or will they let it ride off into the sunset?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Make sweet music with the Pawn Stars as they check out a 1763 Stradivarius violin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have an opportunity to buy a classic 1973 pinball machine in need of some serious repair. Will they rack up a high score and make the deal? Then Corey and Chum meet a guy interested in selling his personal transporter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy a historic silver spoon made by a true American legend--Paul Revere. Can they make a deal and scoop it up, or will this piece of patriotic history ride off into the night?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars are presented with the opportunity to add one of the world's most recognizable trophies to their collection--a Grammy. Will the gang put up the cash to get the gold or will the deal hit a sour note and be taken off the charts?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick has a chance to buy a little piece of militaria he's never had before--a Flame Thrower. Can he turn up the heat and coax a deal or will this deal go up in flames? Corey and Chumlee head to an auction to bid on a classic gypsy fortune-teller machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy a key from the 16th or 17th century, but this key doesn't just open doors, it shoots bullets!

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy one of the quietest air crafts ever made--a vintage Schweizer glider. Will the gang soar into a good deal and restore this glider to its high flying status or will they take it too close to the sun and get burned?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy an extremely rare 18th century double-barrel coaching gun engraved with a mysterious golden script.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Corey has a chance to buy an extremely rare Belgium-made 1942 Sarolea motorcycle, Rick has a big concern...making money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to shoot and score with a 2006 NBA Championship Ring. Will the gang make the big score or will a surprise Shaq Attack throw the shop off its game?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have an opportunity to buy something they've never bought before--a helicopter! Can Rick convince the Old Man to come along and spin up a deal? Then Rick has a chance to buy a 240-year-old lottery ticket.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a look back at 130 episodes of Duck Dynasty,

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a look back at 130 episodes of Duck Dynasty,

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil, Willie and Ms. Kay attempt to produce a cooking video for their fans.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.desc: It hurts Dog to see people who after years of walking the straight and narrow, suddenly lose their way. But today's case is a member of the law enforcement community who has recently gone astray, and that truly troubles the Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Denver helping Bobby Brown to track down a fugitive with a long rap sheet. But unfortunately they have no picture of the felon to work with, so the challenges are big on this one.

programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale. But this only masks deeper problems with the couple.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extra√±o secuestr√≥ a Polly Klaas de doce a√±os durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entr√≥ en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitaci√≥n y descubrieron, a trav√©s del uso de fuentes de luz l√°ser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Despu√©s de una extensa investigaci√≥n de dos meses, el FBI arrest√≥ a Richard Allen Davis. La impresi√≥n de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mary Kay Letourneau, 34 year-old married schoolteacher and mother, was having sex with a 12 year old student, and the story grabbed headlines around the world; it's only the first in a series of wild revelations.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Reverend Randall Foos says it was just an unfortunate accident when his car hit and killed 19-year-old Sara Casey as she rode her bicycle, but a civil suit revealed more than the eye could see, or couldn't, that turned this accident into a crime.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the Historic Calumet Inn, in Pipestone, Minnesota. Joint owners, Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the inn as a gift by their father (who they still call ‚Äúdaddy‚Äù), and they treat it with less respect than a dolls house.

programme.title: Ski A&E

programme.title: Ski A&E
programme.desc: The high-octane casualties include a netball umpire who is told some heart-breaking news, an elderly Canadian stabs his face on a ski pole and a young man completely shatters his arm hurtling down the slopes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for ¬£300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing ¬£5,000 a week.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and d√©cor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars
programme.desc: Gordon's served almost six months in Brixton Prison, but it will mean nothing if he doesn't leave a viable business behind to keep prisoners working and earning.

programme.title: Helicopter ER

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Both choppers are called to a head-on road smash in the Yorkshire Dales that‚Äôs left two pensioners trapped in their wrecked car. Ex Royal Marine pilot Harry swoops on a street in Castleford to drop his medics next to an unconscious cyclist feared to have a brain injury. Paramedics Sammy and Ady find themselves dealing with a difficult patient who insists he wants to climb back on his badly damaged motorbike thanks to bizarre effects of a head injury sustained in the accident. Flying doctor Jez is confronted by a baffling whodunnit after a man is accidentally shot at a firing range. A jockey thrown by his galloping horse amazes the team with his toughness as he undergoes treatment on a broken bone without even flinching. Meanwhile, a crash outside one of Yorkshire‚Äôs most famous stately homes leaves a man with a chronic medical condition trapped in his upturned car. On the moors, paramedics Pete and Lee rescue an off road biker injured when his motorcycle toppled off a rock.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: A grounds worker is crushed against a tree in a freak accident; a car plunges ninety feet off a motorway into a river; a cycle race ends in a painful crash; a fall from a ladder results in a tricky call out for Helimed 99.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigaci√≥n del FBI a gran escala llev√≥ a la recuperaci√≥n de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia f√≠sica fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres proven√≠an de la misma arma. El FBI se gan√≥ la confianza de un informante, cuya informaci√≥n condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When police in a small Washington State community began looking into the disappearance of a 22-year-old woman, they had no way of knowing it would evolve into a nationwide hunt for a sexual sadist. Police knew the killer's identity, but he was a master of disguise. The FBI was called on to help. Agents discovered that several unsuspecting women across the northwest had fallen prey to his charms.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: La Femme Nikita

programme.desc: Nikita uncovers hints of truth about her original recruitment.

programme.title: La Femme Nikita

programme.title: Privileged

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Police officers Van Ray and Deaqon "Deaq" Hayes go undercover to pursue the worst criminals in L.A. They get help from Billie Chambers, their contact within the police department.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq encounter a trio of female jewel thieves who destroy a sports car from the Candy Store. The cops pose as wealthy jewel buyers, but the operation soon goes awry.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq are sent to infiltrate a gang of Russian mobsters. The partners must also stop the contents of a dangerous shipment from entering the United States.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: When Deaq's ex has trouble leaving her abusive husband, Alton, Van worries about Deaq's emotional investment in the case. He and Billie must save Deaq when he's exposed as a cop.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq open a hip Hollywood nightclub to trap a major ring dealing Ecstasy. When the investigation encounters problems, Billie gets involved.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van frees his legendary convict father, Raymond, from prison to help with a counterfeiting case.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: After Deaq poses as a corrupt cop who threatens to expose assassin Sophia Jones, Billie and Van follow her. They must race to prevent Deaq from becoming Sophia's next victim.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie assigns Van and Deaq to infiltrate a drug ring along with Alexa, her best friend from the police academy. The situation quickly worsens, and Alexa's life is put in danger.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq struggle to reconcile their different investigative styles when they go undercover to apprehend a murderous pimp. Soon they must make a life-or-death decision.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie arranges for Van and Deaq to work with Shane, a gang member they've apprehended, to infiltrate a Mexican gang. But Shane proves unreliable and consequences could be deadly.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq pursue a pair of robbers who use an all-girl valet service to gain access. After the guys learn their targets are lesbians, Billie goes undercover to solve this one.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie orders Van and Deaq to train a rookie cop, Jarod. The guys pursue two dangerous blackmailers, but Van is taken hostage. Jarod must take action on his own to save Van.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq infiltrate a criminal enterprise led by a thug who hires out-of-town assassins to kill cops. Meanwhile, Billie fends off the chief investigator from Internal Affairs.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Under increased pressure from the chief investigator of Internal Affairs, Rolland Hill, Billie decides to help Van and Deaq put an end to a recent spate of cop killings.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van, Billie, Deaq and a sexy young counterfeiter, Gretchen, devise a scheme to save Van's father, Raymond, and capture a crime boss.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq's assignment gets complicated when a witness turns out to be a former acquaintance, Cassidy Shaw. And assassin Sophia Jones soon joins forces with Cassidy.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie assigns Van and Deaq to protect the 19-year-old daughter of a former arms dealer. But she hates her father, doesn't comprehend the danger and does not want to be protected.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq try to capture a violent psychopath whose killing spree doesn't seem to make sense. They cope with the frustration of a case that may be too bizarre even for them.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: As the birthday of Deaq's murdered brother approaches, Van and Billie realize that he's coping with painful memories.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie and Van go undercover to end the partnership between a crystal methamphetamine manufacturer, Murdoch Goucher, and a pornography producer, Lena, who distributes the drug.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: After a long undercover operation, Van hopes for some relaxation. But his situation soon becomes life-threatening. Meanwhile, an uncovered secret could bring serious repercussions.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: When a killer named Nick McKussick uses Van, Deaq and Billie to gain control of an incredibly lucrative stash, the lives of countless unknown innocents depend on the cops' success.

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. programme.title: Replay: 7 News Detroit at 6
programme.desc: WXYZ is Detroit's breaking news and weather leader. 7 News Detroit - on-air and online at WXYZ.com.

programme.title: Operation Stolen Bonds: Duping Wise Guy Robbers
programme.desc: Ernie Lijoi is an agent for the Quincy, MA police department, working in tandem with FBI and DEA. An informant tips him off that a crew of bank robbers are looking to sell $800,000 in stolen bonds. Lijoi goes undercover and pretends to want to buy the bonds, while he builds a case against the robbers. He meets the bank robbers in a courtroom to broker the deal and sets a trap to take everyone involved down - including the informant.

programme.title: Operation Whiskey 12: Undercover Attack
programme.desc: Nate Hutchinson is part of an undercover team in Ogden, UT while working for the Weber County Sheriff's Department. After years of undercover operations involving small time drug dealing, the team pays a call to an illegal pot grower. A seemingly routine call explodes when the grower ambushes and shoots five undercover agents, killing one. Hutchinson exhibits unbelievable acts of bravery to save his fellow officers, and miraculously survives being shot 5 times. He returns to the force and the undercover team, driven to have the last word on the cowardly attacker.

programme.title: Operation Straight Arrow: Double Agent Dirty Cop
programme.desc: Stanford, Maine detective John Arnold goes undercover to befriend a drug dealer flying in drugs right under their noses. Along the way, Arnold becomes suspect himself to other officers as he takes on the persona of a dirty cop in order to get inside the organization. The detective plays it perfectly but not before he has to dodge loaded Uzi's and lie detector tests to prove his loyalty to the dealer.

programme.title: Operation 4U Lounge: Crossroads Of Illegal Activity
programme.desc: Ken Storch of the Aurora, CO PD infiltrates a local watering hole to tap into the illegal activity operating in plain sight. He takes on a rich kid druggie persona to get inside a local kingpin's operation to take him down. He also stumbles upon a murder for hire plot that takes place over shots and takes down the double-dealing husband, the wife and her new boyfriend.

programme.title: Descent Into Anarchy
programme.desc: The human toll as Haiti's paramilitary gangs use automatic weapons, child soldiers and sexual violence to terrorize.

programme.title: Sex, Lies and Deepfakes
programme.desc: Online deepfakes and disinformation are targeting women, including prom photos turned into porn. Special explores the devastating impact on women in the age of online harassment.

programme.title: Too Late To Say Sorry
programme.desc: A triple homicide in small town Maine rocks a community and destroys a family. It doesn't take police long to piece together the elements of the crime, and its ruthless cover-up, which point back to a perpetrator close to home.

programme.title: Operation Stolen Bonds: Duping Wise Guy Robbers
programme.desc: Ernie Lijoi is an agent for the Quincy, MA police department, working in tandem with FBI and DEA. An informant tips him off that a crew of bank robbers are looking to sell $800,000 in stolen bonds. Lijoi goes undercover and pretends to want to buy the bonds, while he builds a case against the robbers. He meets the bank robbers in a courtroom to broker the deal and sets a trap to take everyone involved down - including the informant.

programme.title: Operation Whiskey 12: Undercover Attack
programme.desc: Nate Hutchinson is part of an undercover team in Ogden, UT while working for the Weber County Sheriff's Department. After years of undercover operations involving small time drug dealing, the team pays a call to an illegal pot grower. A seemingly routine call explodes when the grower ambushes and shoots five undercover agents, killing one. Hutchinson exhibits unbelievable acts of bravery to save his fellow officers, and miraculously survives being shot 5 times. He returns to the force and the undercover team, driven to have the last word on the cowardly attacker.

programme.title: Operation Straight Arrow: Double Agent Dirty Cop
programme.desc: Stanford, Maine detective John Arnold goes undercover to befriend a drug dealer flying in drugs right under their noses. Along the way, Arnold becomes suspect himself to other officers as he takes on the persona of a dirty cop in order to get inside the organization. The detective plays it perfectly but not before he has to dodge loaded Uzi's and lie detector tests to prove his loyalty to the dealer.

programme.title: Operation 4U Lounge: Crossroads Of Illegal Activity
programme.desc: Ken Storch of the Aurora, CO PD infiltrates a local watering hole to tap into the illegal activity operating in plain sight. He takes on a rich kid druggie persona to get inside a local kingpin's operation to take him down. He also stumbles upon a murder for hire plot that takes place over shots and takes down the double-dealing husband, the wife and her new boyfriend.

programme.title: Descent Into Anarchy
programme.desc: The human toll as Haiti's paramilitary gangs use automatic weapons, child soldiers and sexual violence to terrorize.

programme.title: Sex, Lies and Deepfakes
programme.desc: Online deepfakes and disinformation are targeting women, including prom photos turned into porn. Special explores the devastating impact on women in the age of online harassment.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase: Banksy And The Rise Of Outlaw Art
programme.desc: Mysterious street artist Banksy uses his craft to create political and social statements.
